attributes.action: Exclusion of Speed Camera evidence from prosecution of motorists
attributes.additional_details:
We petition the Government to enact legislation excluding the use of evidence provided by "speed cameras" from any prosecution of motorists, except in certain circumstances as follows :

1) When the speed camera is directly operated by a physical police officer at the roadside or from a police vehicle.

2) When a majority of local people, defined via the electoral roll or similar, support a particular camera at a particular site. Further, we petition that such a majority shall only be recognised if more than 50% of said eligible people actively express an opinion.

This legislation to be presented to House of Commons for debate no later than 12 months after this petition passes the acceptance threshold.
